message: Now to the question - I have gzip = true in the [http] section of my epio.ini. Almost everything is being gzipped, except for one static file.
And here's an example of a file right next to it that is being gzipped: https://provplan.ep.io/static/cache/css/4e3ea8eac70d.css
(So, first off - just uploaded my first ep.io app. I don't know why it took me so long - ep.io kicks ass.)
The odd thing is, files sitting right next to it in the very same directory are being gzipped; I can't figure out why this one wouldn't be.
Here's the URL that isn't being served gzipped: https://provplan.ep.io/static/cache/css/84e8690e610b.css (you can verify quickly at http://www.whatsmyip.org/http_compression/)

Oh, hrm - just realized that file size might be the explanation - your server might be choosing not to zip files under a certain size. Which would make sense; at a certain point the benefits of compression aren't enough to justify the CPU to do it.
@carljm Exactly right; nginx is configured to only gzip things over 1.5kb, for obvious reasons of compression slowing things down at the low end.
